name: Pickled Eggs and Beets
author: Wes
summary: I grow beets to make this. Tasty eaten alone, or as part of a garden salad.
directions: Remove roots and greens from beets
Place beets in a Dutch oven, cover with water, and bring to a boil
Meanwhile, place eggs in a large saucepan and cover with water
Heat to boiling over high heat, then reduce to a simmer and cook for 20 minutes
Rinse in cold water and add a handful of ice to chill the eggs
Remove beets from boiling water and rinse
Combine water, sugar, and vinegar in a saucepan
Add cinnamon, salt, cloves, and pepper; bring to a boil
Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes
Peel and slice beets and place in a glass or plastic container
Peel eggs and place in the same container
Cover and chill in the refrigerator for 24 hours, mixing occasionally to ensure eggs and beets remain covered by liquid
